intro: Eribroma klaineana, commonly known as the narrow-leafed eribroma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. It produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. Eribroma klaineana is adapted to withstand drought and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
